title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 383.5 - Improper utilization of medical assistance identification card
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 383.5 - Improper utilization of medical assistance identification card

State Regulations

If the social services district is advised by the
department that a recipient of medical assistance has utilized his or her
medical assistance payment access card improperly to obtain care or services, the social services district shall: (a) restrict, in accordance with procedures described in section 360.32 of this

Title, the use of such card to a single provider in the restriction category; or
(b) require prior approval of
the social services district for any or all ambulatory care and services
requested by the recipient, except emergency care and services. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18
ยง
383.5

Amended

New

York State Register June 9, 2021/Volume XLIII, Issue 23, eff. 6/9/2021

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
